meanings.definition: Having more plots or schemes than usual.
meanings.sent1: The plottier villain always had a new plan to take over the city.
meanings.sent2: The mystery novel had a plottier storyline than I expected.
meanings.sent3: The plottier character in the movie kept surprising everyone with their schemes.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a plottier maze, full of twists and turns.
meanings.sent5: The plottier nature of the conspiracy made it hard to unravel.

meanings.sent1: She gave him a plottier look, hinting at her secret plans.
meanings.sent2: The plottier coworker always seemed to have something up their sleeve.
meanings.sent3: The plottier cat was always up to something mischievous.
meanings.sent4: His plottier nature made him a master of manipulation.
meanings.sent5: The plottier behavior of the group raised suspicions among the others.

meanings.sent1: This book is plottier than the last one I read.
meanings.sent2: The movie sequel is even plottier than the original.
meanings.sent3: The plottier storyline kept me guessing until the end.
meanings.sent4: The plottier narrative added depth to the overall story.
meanings.sent5: The plottier twists in the plot made it more engaging for the audience.
